content.text: Big news - I left TechCorp and joined DataFlow as a Staff Engineer. Better comp and more interesting problems. Start date was last Monday.
Congrats on the move to DataFlow as Staff Engineer! That's a big step up. How's the first week been?

Also we ended up canceling the CockroachDB migration at TechCorp before I left. Performance benchmarks were disappointing and the licensing costs were too high. They're sticking with PostgreSQL. Lesson learned: always run production-scale benchmarks before committing to a database migration.

That's a valuable lesson about database migrations. Production-scale benchmarks are non-negotiable - synthetic tests can be misleading. Good that the team caught it before going too deep. And at least you dodged that bullet by moving to DataFlow.
At DataFlow they use Go instead of TypeScript. I'm actually starting to prefer Go over Rust now for backend work. The simplicity is refreshing.

Interesting preference shift! Go's simplicity and fast compile times make it great for backend services. Rust is powerful but the borrow checker can slow you down when you just want to ship. Makes sense for your new role at DataFlow.
